Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member was threatening to physically harm a youth when
they were escalated. No physical altercation occurred. Other staff
intervened and the staff member that was being inappropriate
eventually walked away.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 02/03/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed at Vista Maria on 01/02/2025. Youth A
stated she was talking and having a good time with Staff 1 on
Faith wing until Staff 1 started to ask about Youth A’s family.
Youth A stated she does not like to talk about her family and this
caused their conversation to become inappropriate. Youth A
stated Staff 1 threatened to beat her up. Youth A did not have
further details of this incident. Youth A stated Therapist 1 and
Youth B overheard Staff 1 threaten her. Youth A stated Staff 1 has
not worked with her since this incident.
Youth B was interviewed at Vista Maria on 01/02/2025. Youth B
stated Staff 1 was yelling at Youth A when Therapist 1 brought
Youth B back to Faith wing. Youth B stated Staff 1 said, “Better
get me away from this girl. I’m willing to lose my job. Beat her
ass.” Youth B stated Staff 1 left the unit without a physical
altercation with Youth A when assistance staff arrived on the wing.
Youth B stated staff (does not recall who) de-escalated Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/02/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Maria Representative. Staff 1 stated she and Youth A talked about
Youth A’s family and Youth A being adopted while playing
Yahtzee. Staff 1 stated Youth A ended the game and grabbed a
pen off the staff desk. Staff 1 stated Youth A refused to return the
pen and placed the pen cap in her mouth and pocketed the pen.
Staff 1 stated Youth A walked to a couch, picked up the couch
cushion and threw it at Staff 1. Staff 1 stated she asked, “What
game are we playing? I’m not the staff to play with because you
2

don’t know boundary.” Staff 1 stated she moved a book and chair
into the closet to prevent Youth A from throwing them. Staff 1
stated she called for assistance at least four times when Youth A
began to use profanity, throw a granola bar and paper towels.
Staff 1 stated Youth A charged at her and grabbed at Staff 1’s
shirt and threatened to grab Staff 1 by her hair. Staff 1 stated
assistance took too long to arrive and she said, “You all need to
hurry up and get me off the wing.” Staff 1 denied verbally
threatening Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed at Vista Maria on 01/23/2025 with Vista
Maria Representative. Staff 2 stated she walked on to Faith wing
as Staff 1 left the wing. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was irritated and
yelling but does not recall what Staff 1 said. Staff 2 stated she de-
escalated Youth A.
Staff 3 is no longer employed at Vista Maria since 01/06/2025. A
message stated the telephone number is no longer in service and
the call could not be completed when a call was placed to Staff 3
on 02/03/2025.
Therapist 1 was interviewed by phone on 02/03/2025 and at Vista
Maria on 02/12/2025 with Vista Maria Representative. Therapist 1
stated she overheard Staff 1 yelling, “Let me fight. I’m sick of this
shit. I’m gonna beat your ass” in reference to Youth A when she
brought Youth B back to Faith wing. Therapist 1 stated she walked
towards Youth A and tried to redirect Youth A away from Staff 1.
Therapist 1 stated she asked Staff 1 to step off the wing at least
twice. Therapist 1 stated Therapist 2 arrived on the wing and also
requested Staff 1 leave the wing. Therapist 1 stated Staff 1 left the
wing unwillingly and yelled something in the hallway. Therapist 1
stated Youth A yelled something back at Staff 1. Therapist 1
stated Staff 1 is not scheduled to work Faith wing pending this
investigation.
Therapist 2 was interviewed at Vista Maria on 02/12/2025 with
Vista Maria Representative. Therapist 2 stated she responded to
an assistance call on Faith wing and found Youth A and Staff 1
agitated and loudly exchanging words. Therapist 2 stated she
asked Staff 1 to leave the wing at least twice before Staff 1
complied. Therapist 2 did not recall the specific wording but Staff 1
said there would be problems if Youth A did not leave.
Video
12/27/2024 video of Faith wing at 10:21 AM shows Youth A laying
on a couch and then laying on the ground. Youth A pulls, lifts and
3

pushes a chair while on the ground. Staff 1 sits at the staff desk
using her cell phone. Youth A gets up and walks to the staff desk.
Youth A takes something off the staff desk and walks away. Staff
1 gets up from the desk chair and gestures for the object that
Youth A took. Youth A walks towards Staff 1, extends her arm out
and pushes Staff 1. Youth A picks up a couch cushion and tosses
it at Staff 1. Staff 1 catches the couch cushion and puts it back on
the couch. Staff 1 and Youth A move to the staff desk and talk.
Youth A uses both hands and pushes Staff 1’s back when Staff 1
moves the desk chair and another chair towards the closet. Staff 1
uses her walkie talkie. Staff 1 extends an arm out towards Youth A
and Youth A holds and pulls Staff 1’s hand. Youth A swipes items
off the staff desk. Staff 1 puts the two chairs in a closet. Staff 1
uses her walkie talkie. Youth A picks up a stack of paper towel by
the window ledge and throws it. Staff 1 follows Youth A around the
wing and towards the unit’s door. Therapist 1 and Youth B enter
the wing and go to Youth B’s room. Three staff enter the unit. The
video footage cannot be enlarged to show what happens in the
hallway by the unit door. Youth A walks up to the common area
with two staff and the incident ends. Staff 1 is not seen on the
wing at 10:30 AM. The video footage does not record sound.
Documentation
Staff 1 and Therapist 1 wrote incident reports dated 12/27/2024
that coincide with their interviews.
Tour
Upon entering Faith wing, one stands in a short hallway with youth
bedrooms on the right. To the left of this hallway is a closet and
then a staff desk at the end of the hallway. The hallway leads to
the common area, which has several couches positioned to view
the television. Opposite the unit door is a large wall window.
Analysis The agency is found noncompliance when Staff 1 made verbal
threats to harm Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
4

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Additional Finding
Investigation Video
12/27/2024 video of Faith wing shows Staff 1 sitting at the staff
desk using her cell phone.
Documentation
Vista Maria policy and procedure titled Employee Behavior states
“Personal cell phone use is only permitted during scheduled
breaks and are not allowed while in the presence of clients in any
residential program”.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance of their policy and
procedure when Staff 1 used her cell phone on 12/27/2024 at the
staff desk on Faith wing.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
